British history will account for 25 per cent of the marks in the new qualification - the same proportion as currently .
Professor Peter Mandler , President of the Royal Historical Society , said it was important to broaden school history .
' The aspect of recent reforms to GCSE and A - Level most widely greeted with approval by academic historians has been the push to broaden the curriculum beyond the 20th century , ' he said .
